bug.author: EmmettJT
bug.summary: Train network ERROR: 'sequence index out of range'
bug.description:
Hi, System: Ubuntu 18.04 using the anaconda env, TF and DLC version provided here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/tree/master/conda-environments>https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/tree/master/conda-environments</denchmark-link>
GPU/drivers/CUDA version: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43346332/72530685-c8cebb80-3867-11ea-9c9c-b2fd84441966.png></denchmark-link>
I am trying DLC using the GUI for the first time and so attempting to train a network using a small data set (20 labelled images). Everything seems to be working smoothly and I am also able to import tf and start a session so tf seems to be working okay: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43346332/72530627-a6d53900-3867-11ea-80de-7f66d0aa4657.png></denchmark-link>
However, when i click 'train network' I immediately see this error message: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43346332/72530662-bbb1cc80-3867-11ea-9d2c-66ed3b9e3548.png></denchmark-link>
It seems like I have forgotten to do something when setting up the dataset but I cannot work out what it is, please help! Thanks!
